Reasoning: **Analyzing the Shop in Balatro**

Okay, so I'm in the shop phase, Ante 3 of 8, Round 3, with $7. Looking at my current setup, I've got a decent Joker lineup: Mail-In Rebate (Holo), Ride the Bus, Red Card, and Blue Joker. I've got space for one more Joker, which is key right now. The Coupon Tag is active, which means the initial cards and boosters are free – big win! My goal is clear: optimize my score and economy.

The shop items available are The Magician, Scholar, Jumbo Celestial Pack, and Standard Pack. The Hieroglyph voucher is tempting, but not essential right now. Considering the free options, it's a no-brainer to grab them. The immediate question is the order of operations and deciding what will bring me the most immediate and long-term benefit.

Red Card benefits from skipped boosters. The Magician requires target cards in my hand. Scholar looks interesting with its Ace bonus, especially since it is free. I have space in my inventory for it. The Jumbo Celestial Pack offers a planet, and the Standard Pack offers playing cards.

My immediate instinct is to grab the free stuff: Buy Scholar, use Magician, Celestial Pack, and skip a Standard Pack. My first thought was to get the Celestial Pack ASAP to level up my Three of a Kind, but I can't skip the card, which means the Red Card bonus is out. However, if I skip the Standard Pack, Red Card will get +3 Multiplier.

But let's look at the order. The Magician needs a target, so I need to buy it. And, I have space for the Scholar Joker. If I buy Scholar, I get +20 chips, and +4 mult for Aces, which is excellent. I'm going to take the Scholar. The Celestial Pack and Standard Pack are free. 

The question is, do I value a potential Three of a Kind level up or the immediate Red Card boost. Telescope gives me the Earth planet. Leveling up Three of a Kind is usually better, but an immediate Red Card boost is tempting.

This is where I stop and reconsider the plan. I want the most impact. Let's start with Scholar.

Okay, let's just make the decision. I'll take the Scholar, and then figure out the rest! The plan is: Buy Scholar now.

Okay, so we're in Round 3, Ante 3/8, in the SHOP phase. I've got $7 and a decent Joker setup: Mail-In Rebate, Ride the Bus, Red Card (at 0 Mult, which is a key observation), Blue Joker, and Scholar. Telescope is my active voucher (guaranteeing a Planet card if I play a Three of a Kind).

My main goal is to maximize score, but also think of long-term potential. I immediately see the opportunity to leverage the Red Card, which gains +3 Mult for *skipping* any Booster Pack. I can buy the free Jumbo Celestial and Standard packs, *then* choose to skip them to power up the Red Card.

Now, because I have the Telescope, the Jumbo Celestial Pack is guaranteed to have Earth, which boosts Three of a Kind. Leveling up Three of a Kind gets me +20 Chips and +3 Mult. But is that better than the flat +6 Mult I can get on the Red Card? My initial assessment is the universality of the Red Card's Mult outweighs the Three of a Kind's level up, especially with Mail-In Rebate, which provides a flat Mult, and Ride the Bus, which rewards me for using non-face cards. To skip a booster, I must first buy it.

I've already bought the Scholar on Turn 24. So, looking at the SHOP, I need to decide what to buy. The Magician is currently free. Since I don't need the Magician *now*, I can buy the boosters first. So, I will buy the Magician first. Then, buy the Jumbo Celestial pack. Then, buy the standard pack. The goal: skip the packs for the Red Card Mult.

Okay, let's break this down into actionable commands. I will buy The Magician, then the Jumbo Celestial pack, then the Standard pack. The schema says I must use positional arguments, and "buy_card" will be used to purchase the Magician. Also, "buy_booster" will be used to purchase the two booster packs. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
